page.title: 05Farming - Stud Farm
page.content: {Stud Farm, Fritton Common.}The house is C15 timber frame within a Victorian brick shell with barns and stabling in{nine acres of grazing land,}and has been used as a stud for{Anglo-Arabian {horses since 1979}when previous riding school was sold with the loss of Five employees .There are no current emplo_ yees and the stud is run by husband and wife. The stud{owns eight horses at present,no foals were bred in 1985 but usually two or three are born. These are sold privately after being broken in by annually employed proffesionals to the'first' stage feed hay is bought from a nearby farm the stud had grazing right for one sheep,two and two thirds cows and two horses but those were sold by present owners to an adjacent property after their purchase.
